channel.title: Hosted Private Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [BHS1][Veeam] - Version upgrade

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 21, 08:00 - 11:00 UTC

End time : 21/03/2022 11:00 UTC

item.title: [SBG2A/RBX1A][Hosted private cloud] - Migration of MicroServices
item.description:
Mar 16, 15:12 UTC
Completed - Due to an imponderable, we had to rollback this operation. A new operation will be scheduled later.
We apologize for the inconvenience caused

Mar 16, 09:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 12, 06:43 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 16/03/2022 09:00 UTC
End time : 16/03/2022 17:00 UTC
Service impact : No impact in production, only some connection timeout in the automation at the time of the intervention.
Service improvement : The objective of this maintenance is to migrate the current hosted private cloud microservice from standalone container host to Kubernetes infrastructure.

item.title: [RBX2][Hosted private Cloud] - Redundancy degradation
item.description:
Mar 16, 09:29 UTC
Update - UPDATE: Services are slowly returning to normal, the tete that remain affected are: tete-3136b and tete-3141b.

Mar 16, 04:09 UTC
Update - UPDATE: 3139 is back in service again. polrad has been replaced . Progress of the repairs : 1/9

Mar 15, 19:06 UTC
Investigating - Start time: 15/03/2022 16h36 UTC
User impact : We encounter an incident impacting the backup link of Hosted Private Cloud storage services hosted on the following tÃªtes: tete-3133a / tete-3135a / tete-3141a / tete-3298a / tete-3140a / tete-3137a / tete-3136a / tete-3139a / tete-3138a
There is no interruption or degradation on storage.
Ongoing Actions: Our teams are working to restore this backup-link as soon as possible

Thank you for your understanding

OVHcloud Technical team

item.title: [Global][PCC] - Maintenance upgrade host - wave 5
item.description:
Mar 14, 08:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 7, 23:13 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 14/03/2022 08:00 UTC
End time : 18/03/2022 18:00 UTC
Description : If you are from wave 5 you will receive a mail from us and you will be able to schedule again with the manager.
Builds will be pushed to the host, put in maintenance mode, all Virtual machines will be moved with Vmotion and last hosts will be rebooted .
If we meet an issue during the reboot of the host , it will be replaced. (20 min)

If major update have to be done, it will be two successive reboots like this:

Host v6.0 : upgrade major to v6.7, reboot, then upgrade minor to the last build v6.7, reboot.
Host v6.5 : upgrade major to v6.7, reboot, then upgrade minor to the last build v6.7, reboot.
Host v6.7 : upgrade minor to the last build 19195723 if needed, reboot.

If hosts are already on build 19195723, they will be skipped.
Service impact : None
Service improvement : All hosts have to be upgraded frequently due to the VMware's matrix of compatibility and also due to the CVE.

item.description:
Mar 7, 07:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 17, 05:09 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 07/03/2022 07:00UTC
End time : 17/03/2022 17:00UTC
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : All Vrops zones
Service impact : No access to vrops will be be possible during the maintenance
Service improvement : Multiple vulnerabilities in VMware vRealize Operations were privately reported to VMware. Patches and Workarounds are available to address these vulnerabilities in impacted VMware products.
